image.altText: A public bus with a wrap on the back that reads "MyWay+".

props.synopsis: Speaking to Stateline, ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr concedes the government should have waited several more days before rolling out a new public transport ticketing system that was plagued with problems as it went live.

title.children: ACT government concedes it should have postponed MyWay+ rollout by at least a week

image.altText: A laptop computer sits open on a bed in a dark room showing an email account on screen.

props.synopsis: The Canberra woman, who cannot be named for legal reasons, was prepared to pay $20,000 for her parents to be killed and had paid $7,500 towards that goal.

title.children: Woman spared further jail time after hiring hit man to kill parents on dark web

image.altText: A post-impressionist painting of a crowded Australian beach.

props.synopsis: At first glance artists Ethel Carrick and Anne Dangar seem to have little in common besides gender and career choice, but a new exhibition at the National Gallery of Australia is inviting visitors to take a closer look.

title.children: Two 'important yet under-acknowledged' women artists celebrated in National Gallery of Australia exhibition

image.altText: A building sign that reads 'ACT Civil and Administrative Tribunal'.

props.synopsis: The ACT Civil and Administrative Tribunal found the ACT government discriminated against the public servant over her criminal history.

title.children: ACT government ordered to pay former employee $265k after finding she was discriminated against

image.altText: Students in a classroom with male teacher in background.

props.synopsis: Four Canberra schools have recorded above average results in this year's NAPLAN tests of literacy and numeracy skills.

title.children: Four ACT schools perform above average in 2024 NAPLAN tests

image.altText: Georgie sits on a rowing machine, rowing in her workout gear.

props.synopsis: This year's Paris Games was the worst performance from the Australian rowing team at the Olympics in decades, highlighting gaps in the sport's accessibility — but a new initiative set up in Canberra is hoping to change that.

title.children: Some sports aren't accessible to public school students. This program is trying to change that

image.altText: A childcare centre playground with a slide and a sandpit visible.

props.synopsis: The ACT Legislative Assembly acknowledges widespread problems happening at Genius Education, which claims to run more than 30 centres across the country, including five in the ACT.

title.children: ACT government demands answers after Genius childcare staff walk off the job citing delayed wages

image.altText: a girl wearing a hood looks away from the camera towards a window with a fern in it

props.synopsis: Ruby's House is a rare example of a residential service which supports young people who may otherwise fall into homelessness or couch-surfing due to family conflict.

title.children: Olivia ended up homeless due to family conflict — but then she found Ruby's

image.altText: Bank notes wrapped together on a table.

props.synopsis: An international investigation exposes an alleged Russian billion-dollar money laundering network whose reach is said to have spanned more than 30 countries.

title.children: An alleged billion-dollar Russian money laundering network spanning more than 30 countries has been exposed

image.altText: Unidentified male adult walks hand in hand with child

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has agreed to pay redress to victims of child sexual abuse in sporting institutions, ending a stalemate between states, territories and the federal government.

title.children: Victims of child abuse in sports around the country set to get compensation under new deal

image.altText: A North Korean woman in her 30s helps a North Korean man in his 30 sign a document

props.synopsis: News of an unfolding political crisis in South Korea dominated global headlines. But just over the border, North Koreans are kept in the dark. How will the hermit kingdom's leaders respond?

title.children: Why has North Korea stayed silent about South Korea's political crisis?

image.altText: Megan Schutt of Australia celebrates a wicket with two teammates on the centre of the field

props.synopsis: Megan Schutt's ODI best figures and a bright Georgia Voll debut have sunk India to a 12-year low in a one-sided ODI series opener in Brisbane.

title.children: Schutt's five-wicket haul sets up victory for Australia as India crumble to 12-year low

image.altText: Sandra wears a light denim shirt and plays with her daughter in a park on a hot bright day.

props.synopsis: The rise of weight loss drugs is not only changing individual lives, but also reshaping large sections of the economy.

title.children: Millions use weight loss drugs across the globe and it's starting to affect the economy

image.altText: One troops blocks their ears while another sets up what looks like a long missile.

props.synopsis: Ukraine says the body of a mayor captured by Russian forces at the start of their invasion has been returned, while its security service has detained a 16-year-old girl accused of helping Moscow orchestrate an air strike.

title.children: Ukraine says mayor who was jailed by Russia died after torture

image.altText: Glass on ground with Maryborough town sign in background

props.synopsis: The now-14-year-old pleaded guilty to causing a multi-vehicle crash that killed two women and a teenage girl on Queensland's Fraser Coast.

title.children: Teenage boy sentenced to youth detention for triple-fatal stolen car crash

image.altText: A court sketch of a man in a suit in a witness dock

props.synopsis: The former partner of a popular social media influencer is found guilty of murdering his mother as part of a plan to claim life insurance policies he had taken out on her.

title.children: Man whose mother was found dead in her shower after he took out life insurance policies guilty of murder

image.altText: Two men in paramedic uniform walk outside a court house

props.synopsis: A paramedic refused to force entry into a patient's home, despite assurance from a carer that the man was inside and in need of assistance, an inquest hears.

title.children: 'Argy bargy' between paramedic and police on whether to force entry into patient's home, inquest hears

image.altText: composite image featuring chappell roan, overmono and something for kate

props.synopsis: On Spotify Wrapped day, we share the music we loved. But sometimes the data just doesn't seem to match up with our expectations.

title.children: The weirdest things in our Spotify Wrapped this year

image.altText: researchers sinkhole

props.synopsis: The search for a grandmother who is believed to have fallen into a sinkhole in Pennsylvania is now a recovery effort after two days of digging through mud and rock.

title.children: Sinkhole search for missing Pennsylvania grandmother becomes recovery effort

image.altText: A man holding 100 dollar bills in his hand

props.synopsis: The property investor and social media influencer regularly holds cash and prize giveaways on his social media to subscribed members of his rewards club.

title.children: Melbourne businessman Adrian Portelli to face a South Australian court over unlawful lottery charges

image.altText: The outside of Crocosaurus Cove

props.synopsis: Police say two children under the age of 10 are believed to have broken into the reptile park, killing two turtles and injuring four others.

title.children: Two turtles killed, four others injured after break-in at popular Darwin tourist attraction

image.altText: a selfie of a mum and sun smiling while on holidays in America

props.synopsis: A chance encounter at a Robina pub led to the 26-year-old Dylan McPadden's alleged murder in 2023. Tyler Hailes and his partner Jade Laing have been committed to stand trial.

title.children: Man who was fatally stabbed at Gold Coast pub was 'in the wrong place at the wrong time', court hears

image.altText: Exterior of Newcastle court.

props.synopsis: A man accused of the chronic abuse of his daughter with multiple personalities has been found guilty of raping her and a sibling over several years.

title.children: Father found guilty of sexual abuse of daughter with multiple personalities

image.altText: A construction site with a half-collapsed wall visible.

props.synopsis: A 69-year-old man dies and another is rushed to hospital after they were crushed by a wall that collapsed at a construction site in Inglewood.

title.children: Man dies, another rushed to hospital after wall collapse at building site in suburban Perth

image.altText: A pile of golden, crisp potato chips that are fluffy and soft inside.

props.synopsis: A Bunbury woman's payout after she was served toxic hot chips at the city's Chicken Treat franchise has been cut after a successful appeal.

title.children: Woman who ate hot chips seasoned with caustic soda has $1.1m payout slashed

image.altText: A small black ball on a beach

props.synopsis: A small number of balls appeared on the eastern end of Silver Beach in Kurnell on Thursday morning, with the Environmental Protection Authority investigating and Sutherland Shire Council cleaning up the affected area.

title.children: Mysterious balls wash up on Sydney beach as council begins clean-up

image.altText: Pete Hegseth is surrounded by reporters holding microphones and phones.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's defence secretary nominee says he's the victim of a media smear campaign, and he'll "fight like hell" for the job — despite reports the president-elect is already considering replacing him with his one-time Republican rival.

title.children: Trump's Pentagon pick says he'll 'fight like hell' for the job in face of 'smear' campaign

image.altText: A woman holds her phone in her hand, she is sat in front of several small us flags

props.synopsis: A large number of Americans' data has been stolen in a telecoms attack allegedly carried out by a Chinese hacking group dubbed "Salt Typhoon," and according to one senator, the extent and depth of the hack is "absolutely mind-boggling".

title.children: 'Terrifying' Chinese hacking campaign sees large numbers of Americans' data stolen, US officials say

image.altText: A man wearing dark glasses walking outdoors with his head bowed.

props.synopsis: The former teacher was found guilty of unlawful sexual activity with a girl aged between 10 and 17, which related to his time as a teacher in the 1980s.

title.children: Chris Dawson launches appeal over unlawful sexual activity with a student conviction

image.altText: A man standing outside a building and smiling grimly.

props.synopsis: The homes in Bellamack were found to be riddled with defects such as water leaks and cracked tiles, making them unsafe during severe weather.

title.children: Builder of defective Darwin homes loses appeal, still owes more than $2.7m to homeowners

image.altText: A French man with glasses and gray hair sits in parliament.

props.synopsis: The vote has ousted Prime Minister Michel Barnier and his government, meaning President Emmanuel Macron will have to pick a viable successor with over two years of his presidential term left.

title.children: French government toppled by no-confidence motion in blow to President Emmanuel Macron

image.altText: A CCTV image of a man holding up a gun on the footpath in Manhattan, wearing a hoodie.

props.synopsis: Brian Thompson, the chief executive of UnitedHealthcare, was on his way to a corporate meeting when he was attacked.

title.children: Manhunt underway in New York after CEO of largest US health insurer shot dead

image.altText: A large white and red ferry ship is helped into a port city by tugboats.

props.synopsis: As a new Spirit of Tasmania vessel sits in storage in Scotland, its operator is "urgently" trying to find someone to lease it to in Europe. Interest from New Zealand has been ruled out, while a new Sydney service has been considered.

title.children: Spirit of the Mediterranean? Spirit of New Zealand? Leasing new ship proving harder than anticipated

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Redflow CEO Tim Harris.

props.synopsis: Redflow had political backing and a soaring ambition to sell energy storage to the world, but its $10,000 batteries regularly failed within months of installation leaving customers out of pocket.

title.children: Redflow was the great hope of Australian manufacturing. Its collapse left customers with broken batteries

image.altText: A teenage girl carving along a river on a waterski.

props.synopsis: Eira Dalzell has been selected to represent Australia at the World Disabled Water Ski Championships three years after losing some of her fingers in a boating accident.

title.children: Teenage waterskier to represent Australia three years after serious boating accident
